org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the application of George Webster, NOTICE OF APPEAL for A writ of Habeas Corpus.

To the State of Washington and to R. D. Speck, Esq., Sheriff of Spokane County, State of Washington and to Honorable James Z. Moore Prosecuting attorney for Spokane County, Washington, and to P. H. Winston, attorney general for the State of Washington.

Now comes the petitioner, George Webster, and appeals the above entitled cause and the whole thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the city of Washington District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and more especially appeals from that certain order made and entered in the above enttitled cause on the 25 day of July, 1899, by Hon- erable C. H. Hanford, sitting as Circuit Judge denying the petition of petitioner for a writ of Habeas Corpus and refusing to grant the said writ of Ha beas corpus, as in his said petition prayed.

And you will please take notice that the record and pro- ceedings upon the said petition will be duly served through the said above en titled court to the said Supreme Court of the United States at the next regular term thereof upi said named appeal.
Jas Hamilton Lewis James E. Fenton Del Cary Smith Attorneys for petitioner.
Tx No. 781
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In re application of Geo Webster for vs. Writ of Habeas Corpus- Nature of Appeal
Filed July 25 1899 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By RM Hapkins Deputy
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of : George Webster for a Writ of Habeas : Corpus. : O R D E R.

This cause coming on for the hearing upon petition of Petitioner for writ of Habeas Corpus; the Court being advised upon the peti- tion and upon hearing counsel for Petitioner, denies and refuses to grant said Writ. To which ruling of the court Petitoner excepts exceptions allowed.

Petitioner thereupon, gives notice that he appeals from the said ruling of the court and from the whole and every part there- of, and appeals his said peitioner and his said cause and the whole of it and every part thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the City of Washigton, District of Col- umia, and to the next regular term thereof, and particularly appeals from the said ruling of the said court denying and refus- ing to grant the said Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Which said appeal is here and now allowed.
Done in open court this 25th day of July, A. D., 1899.
C.H. Hanford Judge.
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In re application of Geo Webster for vs. Writ of Habeas Corpus Order denying Writ and allowing appeal
Filed July 25 1899 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By RM Hapkins Deputy
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the application of George Webster, for A writ of Habeas Corpus.
United States of America ) State of Washington ) ss County of Spokane. )

I, Clarence W. Ide, United States Marshal for the District of Washington, do hereby certify that I served the original notice of appeal, the original order allowing an appeal, and the original citation on appeal, to the Supreme Court of the United States, and the original notice to the sheriff of Spokane County, Washington, and to the State of Washington, of the several proceedings had and taken in the above entitled cause, on R. D. Speck, Sheriff of Spo- kane County, Washington, in Spokane County, Washington, on the 27th day of July, A.D.1899, by then and there delivering to and leaving with the said R. D. Speck, as sheriffof Spokane County, Washington, personally, a true and correct copy of the said original notice of ap peal, and of the said original order allowing the same, original citation thereon, and of the said original notice of the several pro- ceedings had and taken in the above entitled cause. That I served the original notice of appeal, original order allowing the same and the original citation thereon t o the Supreme Court of the United States, and the original notice of the several proceedings had and taken in the above entitled cause upon t h e State of Washigton on the 27th day of July, A. D.1899, in Spokane County, Washington, by then and there delivering to and leaving with James Z. Moore, prose- cuting attorney in and for Spokane County, Washington, personally, and by then and there delivering to and leaving with Patrick H. Winston, attorney general for the State of Washington, personally, and to each of them personally, a true and correct copy of te origi- nal notice of appeal, original rder allowing the same and of the original citation thereon, and of the original notice of the several proceedings had and taken in the above entitled cause.
C W Ide United States Marshal for the District of Washington. By Felix M Pugh Deputy.
In the Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of George Webster, for A Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Proof of service of Notice of Appeal, and of order allowing appeal, and of Citation on ap- peal, and of Notice of proceed- ings in the above entitled cause.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON AUG231899 A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk. A.N. Moore Dep.
James Hamilton Lewis, James E. Fenton and Del Cary Smith. Attorneys for Petitioner.
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington.
In re appliation of George Webster for Writ of Habeas Corpus No. 781 Appearance
To the Clerk of the above Entitled Court:
You will please enter my appearance as one of the attorneys for George Webster in the above entitled cause John F. Dore
No. 781 Tx Gob 5-190.
United States Circuit Court District of Washington.
In re application of George Webster for Writ of Habeas Corpus Appearance.
Filed Sep 12 1899 189 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. HM Walthew Deputy Clerk. John F. Dore Atty. For petitioner
IN THE SUPREMECOURT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
In re Application of George Webster for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Assignement of Errors.

Now comes the above named George Webster, by James Hamtilon Lewis, James E. Fenton, John F. Dore and Del Cary Smith, his attorneys, and says that the record and proceedings in the above entitled cause in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington and in the Northern Division thereof, there was manifest error and he hereby assigns as error of the Court therein, the following, to wit:
That the Court below erred in denying a writ of habeas corpus to thesaid George Webster and in rendering its order against the granting of said writ on the 25th day of July, 1899.
James Hamilton Lewis James E. Fenton John F Dore Del Cary Smith Attorneys for George Webster.
781 Tx In the Supreme Court of the United States In re application of George Webster for Writ of Habeas Corpus Assigments of Error
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON. Sep141899 A. Reeves Ayres HM Walthew Deputy
James Hamilton Lewis James E. Fenton John F. Dore Del Cary Smith Atys for Webster
HORACE KIMBALL, Deputy Prosecuting Attorney. MILES POINDEXTER, Deputy Prosecuting Attorney.
OFFICE OF JAMES Z. MOORE, PROSECUTING ATTORNEY OF SPOKANE COUNTY, WASHINGTON.
TELEPHONE MAIN 719.
Spokane, Wash., March 21, 1900.
Dict.M.P. Clerk of the U.S. Circuit Court, S e a t t l e, W a s h. Dear Sir:-
Enclosed you will find the mandate of the United States Supreme Court dismissing the appeal of George Webster in the matter of his application for a writ of habeas corpus.
Please acknoledge receipt of same, and oblige,
Very truly yours, Miles Poindexter
United States of America, ss:
The President of the United States of America,
To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington
Greeting,

Whereas, lately in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington before you, or some of you in a cause entitled In the matter of the application of George Webster for a writ of habeas corpus, wherein the order of the said Circuit Court, entered in said cause on the 25th day of July, A.D. 1899, was against the said George Webster.

You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such execution and proceedings be had in said cause as according to right and justice, and the laws of the United States, ought to be had, the said appeal notwithstanding.
Witness the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the United States, the 10th day of February, in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred
COSTS OF Speck, Sheriff rc. etal Clerk $ paid Attorney $ 20.00 $20.00
James H McKenney Clerk of the Supreme Court of the United States.
781 94 G. O. B. 6-298 SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES. No. 443, October Term, 1899. George Webster vs. R. D. Speck, Sheriff re. etal.
M A N D A T E.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. MAR231900 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk RM Hopkins Dep.
Recorded Journal 61 page 192
CERTIFICATE
United States of America ) ss. Western District of Washington )

I, James C. Drake, Clerk of the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, do hereby certify that the foregoing attached papers constitute the JUDGMENT ROLL in the foregoing entitled cause, No. 781 wherein Inre: Application of George Webster for a Writ of Habeas Corpus Plaintiff and Defendant
In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto act my hand and offered the Seal of said Circuit Court, this the 30 day of Dec A. D. 1911 James C. Drake, Clerk.
By BO Wright Deputy Clerk.
